mists 0.0.0.9000
  • Reference

Run lengths encoding for missing values (NA)

na-rle.Rd

Run lengths encoding for missing values (NA)

na_rle(x = double(), index_by = seq_along(x), interval = NULL)

na_rle_lengths(x)

na_rle_indices(x)

list_of_na_rle(x = double(), index_by = seq_along(x),
  interval = NULL)

# S3 method for mists_rle_na
as_list_of(x, ...)

Arguments

x

A vector.
index_by

A vector of the same length as x.
interval

if NULL, determined by the greatest common denominator; otherwise a supplied "interval" class. See ?tsibble::tsibble for details.
...

Vectors to coerce.

Value

A named list of

  • lengths: the lengths of NA runs

  • indices: the starting indices of runs

Mathematical operations

Many math operations can be applied to objects returned from na_rle() and list_of_na_rle(), regarding the lengths of runs.

  • sum(): the total number of NA over all runs.

  • mean(): the average NAs per run.

  • min() & max(): the minimum and maximum of runs.

  • median() & quantile()

Examples

df <- data.frame(year = 2000:2019, temp = sample(0:30, size = 10))
df[c(1, 6, 13:16, 19), "temp"] <- NA

na_rle(df$temp) # indexed by the default positions
#> <Run Length Encoding <NA>[4]>
#> $lengths: <int> 1 1 4 1 
#> $indices : <int>  1  6 13 19
(x <- na_rle(df$temp, index_by = df$year)) # indexed by a variable
#> <Run Length Encoding <NA>[4]>
#> $lengths: <int> 1 1 4 1 
#> $indices : <int> 2000 2005 2012 2018

na_rle_lengths(x)
#> [1] 1 1 4 1
na_rle_indices(x)
#> [1] 2000 2005 2012 2018
#> attr(,"interval")
#> 1Y

length(x) # the number of runs
#> [1] 4
sum(x) # the total number of `NA`
#> [1] 7
range(x) # min & max runs
#> [1] 1 4

library(dplyr, warn.conflicts = FALSE)
# list_of_na_rle() is useful when working with tabular data
na_rle_df <- as_tibble(df) %>%
  summarise(na_runs = list_of_na_rle(temp, year))
na_rle_df
#> # A tibble: 1 x 1
#>           na_runs
#>   <list<rle<NA>>>
#> 1             [4]

length(na_rle_df$na_runs)
#> [1] 1
sum(na_rle_df$na_runs)
#> [1] 7
range(na_rle_df$na_runs)
#> [1] 1 4
